abstract: While NBC garnered Wednesday night’s largest audience with “America’s Got Talent” at 9 p.m., which averaged 11.7 million viewers, according to Nielsen’s estimates, Fox’s two-hour installment of “So You Think You Can Dance” (7.5 million) lifted that network to No. 1 for the night in the demographic of adults 18 to 49.
snippet: While NBC garnered Wednesday night’s largest audience with “America’s Got Talent” at 9 p.m., which averaged 11.7 million viewers, according to Nielsen’s estimates, Fox’s two-hour installment of “So You Think You Can Dance” (7.5 million) lifted tha...
lead_paragraph: In a closely fought night in the ratings on Wednesday, all four of the major broadcast networks posted highlights they could boast about. While NBC garnered the night’s largest audience with “America’s Got Talent” at 9 p.m., which averaged 11.7 million viewers, according to Nielsen’s estimates, Fox’s two-hour installment of “So You Think You Can Dance” (7.5 million) lifted that network to No. 1 for the night in the demographic of adults 18 to 49.

headline.main: Wednesday Ratings: A Good Night for Reality
